intro: Robiquetia wassellii, commonly known as the Wassell's rock fig, is a rare and unique plant native to the arid regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Moraceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces edible fig-like fruits that are enclosed in a woody capsule, a distinctive feature of the genus Robiquetia. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Robiquetia wassellii is considered a vulnerable species.
